channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: 84% of Mexican hand sanitizers toxic or flawed; FDA issues drastic alert
item.description: The regulatory agency has issued alerts for over 200 products.

item.title: Vehicle recalls cluster because OEMs wait for rivals to move first
item.description: Fears of falling stock prices may be responsible for the phenomenon.

item.title: The Trump administration left Biden with a rocket dilemma
item.description: “NASA needs to go back and look at what the options are to go to the Moon.”

item.title: Chromecast, Fire TV Stick, or Roku: What’s the best streaming stick for ~$50?
item.description: We pit the three premier $50 streaming sticks head-to-head to see which is best.

item.title: Basic pandemic safety limits spread in schools
item.description: Infections spread in a school system were far lower than in its surrounding towns.

item.title: Warrior princess fights to save humanity in Raya and the Last Dragon trailer
item.description: “I wish to join this fellowship of butt-kickery.”

item.title: Plex adds game-streaming as paid add-on, completely botches the landing
item.description: $4.99/mo service needs to straighten many issues before meriting the cost.

item.title: Sony adds HDMI to last year’s Android phone, charges $2,500
item.description: It’s not a foldable. It’s not plated in gold. It just has an HDMI port.

item.title: SpaceX adds laser links to Starlink satellites to serve Earth’s polar areas
item.description: Laser links connect Starlink satellites, reducing need for ground stations.

item.title: iOS 14.4 and iPadOS 14.4 hit supported devices today
item.description: Apple also released tvOS 14.4 and watchOS 7.3.

item.title: Sony’s best noise-cancelling headphones are down to their lowest price today
item.description: Dealmaster also has discounts on LG OLED TVs, Apple’s M1 Mac Mini, and more.

item.title: Google Play bans video app for standard “.ass” subtitle support
item.description: “Advanced Sub Station alpha” files, or a naughty word for a butt? Who knows!

item.title: Apple’s long-time hardware lead steps down to work on mysterious “new project”
item.description: It’s unusual for the leader of department to shift focus to just one product.

item.title: Biden vows to electrify the federal government’s 600,000-vehicle fleet
item.description: Fewer than 0.5 percent of federal vehicles were battery electric in 2019.

item.title: “We’re failing”: Ex-Warp Speed leader proud, deflects blame on vaccines
item.description: Slaoui defends his team, says criticism is a “huge misunderstanding.”

item.title: North Korea hackers use social media to target security researchers
item.description: Google finds use of bogus Twitter, LinkedIn profiles to identify vulnerabilities.

item.title: Why Red Hat killed CentOS—a CentOS board member speaks
item.description: “The CentOS Board doesn’t get to decide what Red Hat engineering teams do.”

item.title: How to shut off a quasar
item.description: Galaxy collisions may both activate and power down black-hole powered galaxies.

item.title: New RISC-V hardware designs from 5G startup EdgeQ
item.description: Extending an open RISC-V CPU design is easier than building standalone ASICs.

item.title: Not just MagSafe: Apple reminds users not to hold iPhones near pacemakers
item.description: In response to iPhone 12 fears, Apple updates support hub with revised guidance.

item.title: Deactivation of Flash may have crippled Chinese railroad for a day [Updated]
item.description: Railroad officials were blindsided by the long-scheduled deactivation of Flash.

item.title: AT&T may keep majority ownership of DirecTV as it closes in on final deal
item.description: It’s unclear whether AT�T will maintain operational control of DirecTV.

item.title: Bad news for land-speed record fans as Bloodhound goes up for sale
item.description: After testing to 628mph in 2019, the car now needs its rocket engine integrated.

item.title: How Final Fantasy VII Remake legitimizes sexuality and gender identity
item.description: Over 20 years later, “Cloud in a dress” isn’t just treated as a joke.

item.title: Apple doubles down on Fitness+ with new “Time to Walk” Apple Watch content
item.description: Dolly Parton, Shawn Mendes, and more lend their voices to the first episodes.

item.title: SpaceX now set to launch its next Starship prototype Tuesday [Updated]
item.description: It’s only been about six weeks since SN8 flew.

item.title: “I can’t tell you how much vaccine we have,” new CDC head says
item.description: Biden admin officials work to manage expectations on topsy-turvy vaccine rollout.

item.title: The secret to this $5,000 electric motorcycle is a cast aluminum frame
item.description: The Sondors Metacycle will have a range of 80 miles and a top speed of 85mph.

item.title: Google Maps will soon show COVID vaccine locations
item.description: Vaccine site listings will show access requirements and appointment info.

item.title: Egyptian archaeologists unearth dozens of tombs at Saqqara necropolis
item.description: The graves may belong to people who worshipped the pharaoh Teti, buried nearby.

item.title: Valve’s Gabe Newell imagines “editing” personalities with future headsets
item.description: “Remember when Bob got hacked by Russian malware [and] ran naked through forests?”

item.title: The history of the connected battlespace, part one: Command, control, and conquer
item.description: Since the end of World War II, the US and allies have tried to network-enable war.

item.title: Godzilla vs. Kong trailer is a rock ‘em, sock ’em monster mashup
item.description: Directed by Adam Wingard, it’s the fourth installment in the “MonsterVerse” franchise

item.title: A curious observer’s guide to quantum mechanics, pt. 3: Rose colored glasses
item.description: “How big is a particle?” Well, that’s a subtle (and, unsurprisingly, complex) question.

item.title: Review: Lupin updates classic French gentleman thief for the 21st century
item.description: Omar Sy heads stellar cast in clever series inspired by the works of Maurice Leblanc

item.title: SpaceX launches 143 satellites into orbit, most ever [Updated]
item.description: Party in the payload bay: 143 total satellites deployed in a dozen waves.

item.title: Is this a fossilized lair of the dreaded bobbit worm?
item.description: The giant worms hunted in pretty much the most nightmarish way possible.

item.title: DDoSers are abusing Microsoft RDP to make attacks more powerful
item.description: DDoS amplification attacks have abused all kinds of legit services. Now, it’s Windows.

item.title: What’s the technology behind a five-minute charge battery?
item.description: The company behind a new battery isn’t saying much, but we figured a few things out.

item.title: The art and science of boarding an airplane in a pandemic
item.description: Researchers and airlines obsessed over efficiency now worry about safety, too.

item.title: This site posted every face from Parler’s Capitol Hill insurrection videos
item.description: Faces of the Riot used open source software to detect, extract, and deduplicate every face.

item.title: What happens to the brain on sudden impact? Egg yolks could hold the answer
item.description: Rotational deceleration causes most deformation—like getting punched on the chin

item.title: Waymo CEO dismisses Tesla self-driving plan: “This is not how it works”
item.description: Elon Musk and John Krafcik have very different theories about driverless tech.

item.title: Blizzard absorbs acclaimed Activision studio as a dedicated “support” team [Updated]
item.description: Vicarious Visions impressed with Tony Hawk 1+2. Now? Possibly a Diablo II remake.

item.title: Military intelligence buys location data instead of getting warrants, memo shows
item.description: A long and growing list of agencies are using money to bypass Carpenter ruling.

item.title: Home alarm tech backdoored security cameras to spy on customers having sex
item.description: Employee for ADT accessed ~200 customer cams on more than 9,600 occasions.

item.title: How desperate are you for GPUs, CPUs, consoles? Newegg tests with new lottery
item.description: System counters (some) issues with scalpers, inventory, but are the hoops worth it?

item.title: Google: We’ll shut down Australian search before we pay news sites for links
item.description: Tim Berners-Lee says Aussie law would break a fundamental principle of the Web.

item.title: Report: The MacBook Air is getting a major redesign, too
item.description: Also, a bit of a bombshell: The new MacBook Pro will have an SD card slot.
